definitions: the act of going from one place to another for work or pleasure
regular practice of making journeys to different locations
examples: Traveling through Europe taught her about different cultures entirely
His job requires constant traveling between company offices worldwide
Traveling became her passion after visiting twenty countries last year
The pandemic significantly reduced international traveling for many families

definitions: person who travels from one place to another especially regularly
member of traditionally nomadic ethnic group living in caravans
examples: The weary traveller stopped at the inn for refreshment
Business travellers prefer hotels near airports for convenience
The traveller community has faced discrimination throughout British history
Local authorities must provide sites for traveller families

definitions: the activity of going from place to place especially for pleasure
characteristic of moving from location to location regularly
examples: Travelling broadens the mind through exposure to new cultures
She documented her travelling experiences in a popular blog
The travelling circus entertained children in small towns nationwide
His travelling lifestyle made maintaining relationships particularly difficult

definitions: written or filmed record of places visited during travels
documentary film or television program about travel experiences
examples: Her travelogue about hiking the Andes became a bestseller
Victorian travelogues shaped European perceptions of distant lands
The television travelogue featured stunning footage of remote islands
He presented his travelogue to the geographic society last evening

definitions: act of moving across or through something from side to side
systematic visiting of nodes in a tree or graph data structure
examples: The mountain traversal required specialized climbing equipment and expertise
Safe traversal of the glacier demands experienced guides
The algorithm uses depth-first traversal to search the tree
Graph traversal methods include breadth-first and depth-first approaches

definitions: route or path across difficult terrain or obstacle
sideways movement in climbing or skiing across a slope
formal denial of allegation in legal pleading
examples: The narrow traverse along the cliff face terrified novice climbers
Rangers marked the safest traverse across the avalanche zone
She executed a perfect traverse across the steep ski slope
The climbing traverse required careful foot placement
The defendant filed a traverse denying all allegations
His traverse challenged the plaintiff's version of events

definitions: false, absurd, or distorted representation of something important or serious
event or situation that is shocking failure or mockery
examples: The movie was a travesty of the beloved original novel
His performance was a travesty of Shakespeare's intended character
The trial became a travesty of justice with biased proceedings
The election was a complete travesty of democratic principles

definitions: large fishing net dragged along the sea bottom
extensive search through large amount of information or material
examples: The fishing boat deployed its trawl at dawn
Commercial trawls can damage delicate ocean floor ecosystems
Police conducted a trawl through thousands of phone records
Her trawl through archives revealed forgotten historical documents

definitions: commercial fishing boat that uses nets to catch fish
examples: The trawler returned to port with its hold full
Storm warnings forced all trawlers back to harbor immediately
Deep-sea trawlers spend weeks at sea fishing distant waters
The old trawler was converted into a floating restaurant

definitions: flat container with raised edges for carrying or holding items
compartmented container for organizing papers or office supplies
examples: She carried drinks on a silver serving tray
The cafeteria tray slipped from his hands accidentally
His desk tray contained urgent correspondence requiring immediate attention
The letter tray overflowed with unread mail

definitions: violation of allegiance or faith through betrayal of trust
deceptive action against someone who trusts you
examples: His treachery shocked those who had trusted him completely
The general's treachery led to the fortress's unexpected fall
Political treachery undermined the peace negotiations between rival factions
She never forgave his treachery in revealing her secrets

definitions: thick, sticky dark syrup produced when refining sugar
excessively sweet or sentimental speech, writing, or behavior
examples: The recipe called for two tablespoons of black treacle
Treacle tart remains a popular British dessert
The film's dialogue was pure treacle without genuine emotion
His speech descended into treacle when discussing family values

definitions: raised pattern on tire surface that grips the road
sound or manner of walking or stepping
horizontal part of step where foot is placed
examples: The tire tread was worn dangerously thin
Winter tires have deeper tread for better snow traction
We heard the heavy tread of boots approaching
Her light tread barely disturbed the sleeping cat
The stair tread creaked under his considerable weight
Rubber strips on each tread prevent dangerous slipping

definitions: motorized exercise machine with moving belt for running or walking
tedious routine or situation seeming to go nowhere
examples: She runs five miles daily on her home treadmill
The gym's treadmills face large windows overlooking the park
Work felt like an endless treadmill of repetitive tasks
He escaped the corporate treadmill to pursue his passion

definitions: crime of betraying one's country especially by attempting overthrow
action of betraying sovereign or government
examples: He was charged with high treason against the crown
Treason carries the death penalty in some countries still
Selling military secrets to enemies constitutes treason
The general's attempted coup was considered treason

definitions: collection of valuable objects such as gold, silver, or jewels
person or thing that is highly valued or appreciated
examples: Pirates buried treasure on remote Caribbean islands centuries ago
The museum's treasure includes priceless ancient artifacts
Her grandmother was the family's greatest treasure
This old photograph album is my personal treasure

definitions: person who is in charge of the funds of an organization
official responsible for collecting and managing money
examples: The club treasurer presented the annual financial report
She served as treasurer for three consecutive terms
The state treasurer manages billions in public funds
Our treasurer keeps meticulous records of all transactions

definitions: government department responsible for public revenue and finances
place where money or valuable items are kept
collection of valued literary or artistic works
examples: The Treasury announced new economic measures this morning
Treasury bonds are considered very safe investments
The cathedral treasury contains medieval religious artifacts
Access to the treasury requires multiple security clearances
This anthology is a treasury of world poetry
Her cookbook is a treasury of family recipes

definitions: event or item that gives someone special pleasure
medical care or procedure for illness or injury
examples: Ice cream on Fridays was their weekly treat
The surprise party was a wonderful treat for everyone
The new treatment shows promise for cancer patients
Regular treats help maintain positive behavior in dogs

definitions: formal systematic written discourse on a particular subject
comprehensive scholarly examination of a specific topic
examples: Darwin's treatise on evolution revolutionized biological science
She published a treatise on medieval manuscript illumination
The philosopher's treatise examined the nature of consciousness
His legal treatise became the standard reference work

definitions: medical care given to patient for illness or injury
manner of behaving toward or dealing with someone or something
presentation or discussion of subject in art or literature
examples: The treatment required six weeks of physical therapy
New cancer treatments offer hope to terminal patients
Employees complained about unfair treatment by management
The preferential treatment of certain students caused resentment
The film's treatment of historical events sparked controversy
Her treatment of the subject showed remarkable sensitivity

definitions: formal agreement between countries or governments signed and ratified
formal contract between parties
examples: The peace treaty ended five years of warfare
Nations must ratify treaties through their legislative processes
The treaty established new trade relationships between neighboring countries
Breaking the treaty would have serious diplomatic consequences

definitions: highest part or voice in harmonized music
threefold amount or number
examples: The choir's treble section sang the melody beautifully
He adjusted the treble on his stereo system
Company profits reached treble their previous year's figures
The penalty includes treble damages for willful violation

definitions: medieval siege engine using counterweight to launch projectiles
large catapult used in warfare before gunpowder
examples: The trebuchet could hurl stones weighing several hundred pounds
Medieval armies used trebuchets to breach castle walls
Museum visitors watched a working trebuchet demonstration
Building a model trebuchet teaches principles of physics

definitions: perennial woody plant with trunk and branches forming crown
diagram showing relationships in branching hierarchical structure
examples: The oak tree had stood for over two hundred years
Children love climbing trees in the neighborhood park
The family tree traced ancestors back five generations
The decision tree helped visualize all possible outcomes

definitions: plant with leaves divided into three leaflets like clover
ornamental design of three rounded lobes used in architecture
examples: The meadow was carpeted with yellow trefoil flowers
Farmers plant trefoil as nutritious fodder for livestock
Gothic windows often feature trefoil decorative patterns
The trefoil symbol appears throughout the medieval manuscript

definitions: long difficult journey especially on foot through rough terrain
organized journey with specific purpose
examples: Their trek through the Himalayas lasted three weeks
The daily trek to school took two hours each way
The annual trek raises funds for mountain rescue services
Star Trek popularized the word in popular culture

definitions: involuntary shaking movement from fear, excitement, or weakness
slight earthquake or earth vibration
examples: Her hands developed a noticeable tremble with age
A tremble in his voice betrayed his nervousness
The earthquake's tremble lasted only a few seconds
We felt a slight tremble as the train passed

definitions: state or action of shaking involuntarily from emotion or weakness
vibrating or quivering movement
examples: The trembling in her hands made writing difficult
His trembling betrayed his fear despite brave words
The trembling of leaves signaled an approaching storm
The bridge's trembling under heavy traffic concerned engineers

definitions: slight earthquake or seismic vibration of earth's surface
involuntary shaking of body part from disease or emotion
sudden feeling of fear or excitement passing through group
examples: Seismologists recorded a minor tremor this morning
The tremor measured 3.2 on the Richter scale
The doctor noted a persistent tremor in her left hand
Parkinson's disease often causes characteristic tremors
A tremor of excitement ran through the waiting crowd
News of the scandal sent tremors through financial markets

definitions: long narrow excavation in ground for drainage or foundation
defensive excavation used in warfare for protection
long narrow steep-sided depression in ocean floor
examples: Workers dug a trench for the new water pipes
The drainage trench prevented flooding during heavy rains
Soldiers lived in trenches during World War One
The enemy trenches were only fifty yards away
The Mariana Trench is earth's deepest ocean point
Deep ocean trenches form at tectonic plate boundaries

definitions: general direction in which something is developing or changing
current style or preference in fashion or social behavior
examples: Market trends indicate growing demand for renewable energy
The trend toward remote work accelerated during the pandemic
Fashion trends change rapidly in the digital age
Social media influencers often set new trends

definitions: framework of vertical and diagonal supports for bridge or table
supporting structure with legs and crosspieces
examples: The railroad trestle spanned the deep mountain gorge
Wooden trestles supported the temporary construction platform
They assembled trestle tables for the outdoor wedding reception
The artist's canvas rested on adjustable trestles

definitions: playing card or die face showing three spots
three-point shot in basketball
examples: He drew a trey of spades from the deck
The dice showed double treys
The guard hit another trey from beyond the arc
His ability to shoot treys changed the game completely

definitions: group or set of three related people or things
chord of three musical notes
Chinese criminal organization
examples: The executive triad includes CEO, CFO, and COO
This therapeutic triad addresses mind, body, and spirit
The C major triad consists of C, E, and G notes
Jazz musicians often extend basic triads with additional notes
Police investigated triad involvement in the smuggling operation
The triad controlled gambling in that district

definitions: process of sorting patients by urgency of medical need
system of assigning priority order to projects or tasks
examples: Emergency room triage ensures critical cases receive immediate care
The nurse performed triage on arriving accident victims
We need to triage these bug reports by severity
Project triage helped focus resources on critical deliverables

definitions: formal examination of evidence in court to decide guilt
test of performance, qualities, or suitability of something
difficult or challenging experience that tests character
examples: The murder trial lasted six weeks
The defendant requested a trial by jury
Clinical trials of the vaccine showed promising results
They offered a free trial period for the software
Caring for her sick mother was a real trial
The expedition faced many trials in the wilderness

definitions: plane figure with three straight sides and three angles
percussion instrument of steel rod bent into triangular shape
situation involving three people in complex emotional relationship
examples: The triangle has interior angles totaling 180 degrees
Children learn to identify triangles in kindergarten
She played the triangle in the school orchestra
The triangle's clear tone cuts through orchestral texture
Their love triangle complicated the workplace dynamics
The romantic triangle became tabloid headlines

definitions: determining location by measuring angles from known points
using multiple methods or sources to validate research findings
political positioning between opposing viewpoints
examples: GPS uses satellite triangulation to determine exact position
Surveyors employed triangulation to map the territory accurately
The study used triangulation combining interviews and observations
Data triangulation strengthened the research conclusions significantly
The candidate's triangulation alienated their traditional base
Political triangulation seeks the moderate center position

definitions: strong loyalty to one's tribe or social group
behavior showing strong loyalty while excluding others
examples: Tribalism in politics prevents constructive dialogue
Social media tends to reinforce tribalism
Corporate tribalism between departments hindered collaboration
The country struggled with ethnic tribalism

definitions: social group of families living together under chief or elder
taxonomic category between family and genus in biology
examples: The tribe gathered for their annual harvest celebration
Many tribes maintain their traditional customs today
The botanist classified the plant in the tribe Paniceae
This tribe includes several genera of grasses

definitions: cause of great trouble or suffering over extended period
state of great trouble or suffering
examples: The family endured many tribulations during the war years
Religious texts often speak of trials and tribulations
The tribulations of poverty affected generations of families
She faced her tribulations with remarkable courage

definitions: court of justice or judicial assembly to conduct hearings
body established to settle certain types of dispute
examples: The war crimes tribunal prosecuted military leaders
The employment tribunal ruled in favor of the worker
International tribunals address human rights violations
The tribunal hearing lasted three days

definitions: elected official in ancient Rome protecting plebeian interests
raised platform or pulpit for public speaking
name used by various newspapers
examples: The tribune vetoed the senate's proposed legislation
Roman tribunes held considerable political power
The speaker addressed crowds from the ornate tribune
The cathedral's tribune overlooks the main nave
The Chicago Tribune is a major American newspaper
He worked as a reporter for the Tribune

definitions: river or stream flowing into larger river or lake
state or ruler that pays tribute to another
examples: The Missouri River is the longest tributary of the Mississippi
Small tributaries feed the main river system
The kingdom became a tributary of the empire
Tributary states paid annual tribute for protection

definitions: act, statement, or gift showing respect, gratitude or affection
payment made by one state or ruler to another
examples: The concert was a tribute to jazz legends
Flowers at the memorial paid tribute to victims
The conquered nation paid annual tribute to Rome
Tribute payments ensured protection from invasion

definitions: very brief moment or instant of time
examples: She solved the puzzle in a trice
The magician made the coin disappear in a trice
He'll be back in a trice with your order
The opportunity vanished in a trice

definitions: large muscle at back of upper arm with three points of attachment
any muscle having three heads or points of origin
examples: Dips are excellent for building triceps strength
The triceps extends the forearm at the elbow
He tore his triceps during the weightlifting competition
The exercise targets both biceps and triceps

definitions: action intended to deceive or cheat someone
skillful act performed for entertainment or display
cards played in one round of card game
examples: The con artist's trick fooled dozens of victims
That old trick won't work on me again
The magician performed amazing card tricks
She taught her dog several new tricks
He won the trick with the ace of spades
In bridge, you must win six tricks minimum

definitions: practice of deception to achieve goals through dishonest methods
use of tricks to deceive or cheat people
examples: The salesman used trickery to sell defective products
Political trickery undermined the democratic process
They obtained the contract through trickery and false promises
His trickery was eventually exposed by investigators
